CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 15, 1961, pg. A20 reads: "Fashion Preview - Seen above are three of the models who will be featured in the biggest fashion review ever staged in the Homewood-Brushton area, when the Homewood Community Improvement Association and its 77 Block Clubs present "New Frontiers in Fashions," at Westinghouse High School, April 28, at 8 P.M. More than 800 are expected.  Left to right: Carole Robinson, wearing a black and white check sheath with black patent accessories, from the Homewood Dress Shop; Beverly Malone, in black and gold brocade, a Marie Jeanne Original, with matching hat, and Barbara Elaine Williams, in a black linen sheath with white adjustable organdy collar, from Sapper's Style Shoppe. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Carole Robinson, Beverly Malone, and Barbara Elaine Williams, modeling clothing in Westinghouse High School for "New Frontiers in Fashions" fashion review
